Job Title: Manager, Digital Agriculture and Artificial Intelligence
Ad Text:
GRDC

As one of the world's leading grains research organisations, the Grains Research and Development Corporation (GRDC) plays an integral role in driving research outcomes and innovations that directly benefit Australia's grain industry. GRDC's purpose is to invest in research, development and extension (RD&E) to create enduring profitability for Australian grain growers.  

We are seeking a Manager, Digital Agriculture and Artificial Intelligence based in Adelaide.

GRDC is happy to review applications from alternate locations on a case-by-case basis, noting that Adelaide and Canberra are preferred.

Role

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Enabling Technologies, you will lead the identification, development, and management of R&D investments that apply digital agronomy, precision agriculture, and AI-driven solutions to the grains sector. You’ll work across a diverse portfolio—from remote sensing and on-farm automation to data-driven crop management—ensuring projects deliver real value to Australian grain growers.

Key responsibilities

Developing and managing high-impact R&D proposals and investments.

Providing technical leadership across GRDC’s broader portfolio, including genetics, crop protection, and farming systems.

Building and maintaining strong networks with industry, research, and commercial partners.

Supporting commercialisation and adoption pathways for innovative technologies.

About you

The ideal candidate will have:

5+ years of experience in digital agriculture, ag-tech, data science, or agronomy.

Proven ability to develop business cases and manage complex R&D projects.

Strong negotiation, facilitation, and stakeholder engagement skills.

A passion for innovation and a track record of delivering results in a collaborative environment.

Mandatory Requirements

Valid Australian Driver’s Licence.

Willingness to travel as required.

What we offer:

We know that great work happens when our people feel supported. Here's how we make that happen:

Hybrid Working Model – We offer a true 50/50 hybrid approach. Collaborate in person and balance it with focused work-from-home days.

Wellness Support – Access an annual wellness fund to support your physical, mental, or emotional wellbeing.

Set Up for Success – Support to set up your remote workspace comfortably and effectively.

Extra Time Off – Enjoy a paid shutdown between Christmas and New Year.

Supportive Parental Leave – Paid parental leave for both mums and dads (following a qualifying period).

A Supportive Team Culture – Be part of a capable, collaborative team that values trust, initiative, and shared success.

For more information about working with GRDC, please visit https://grdc.com.au/about/careers 

For more information about the role, please contact recruitment@grdc.com.au

Closing date: 30 January 2026

GRDC is committed to supporting an inclusive and diverse workforce and welcomes and encourages applications from People with Disability (PwD), First Nations peoples, LGBTIQA+ people, people from Culturally and Linguistically Diverse (CALD) backgrounds, mature age and young workers. GRDC will provide reasonable adjustments for candidates to participate equitably in the recruitment process and discuss workplace adjustments to fulfil the inherent requirements of the role.

Category:

Other (Education & Training)
Ad Text:
Multiple opportunities | Varied portfolio of projects
Be challenged. Make an impact. Imagine with us.
Onsite Roles with flexible work arrangements

Are you an experienced and adaptable Business Analyst looking to broaden your impact? The Digital Technology Solutions (DTS) team at the University of Newcastle is seeking multiple Business Analysts to support a diverse range of projects and delivery streams across the University.

The role

We are recruiting for several Business Analyst positions to work across a variety of initiatives and delivery streams within DTS. These roles offer the opportunity to contribute to complex, meaningful initiatives and services that enhance the experience of students, staff, and the broader University community. As a Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and digital solutions, supporting the full lifecycle of business and system improvement initiatives—from discovery and requirements definition through to solution design, testing, implementation, and post-delivery optimisation.

You will work closely with stakeholders, end-users, and delivery teams to analyse requirements, optimise processes, and contribute to the successful delivery of user-centred solutions in a dynamic higher education environment.

What you’ll do:

Engage with stakeholders through workshops, interviews, and consultations to understand business needs and document clear, fit-for-purpose requirements
Translate business requirements into functional and non-functional specifications that guide solution design and delivery
Collaborate with technical and delivery teams to design and validate solutions aligned with enterprise standards and organisational objectives
Analyse current processes and systems, identify gaps, and recommend improvements that deliver measurable business value
Support solution testing activities, including test case development and user acceptance testing coordination
Contribute to project planning, estimation, scheduling, and governance activities
Maintain high-quality documentation such as process maps, user stories, system specifications, and change artefacts
Support implementation and post-go-live activities, including issue resolution, benefits realisation, and continuous improvement
Build strong relationships across business and technical teams to ensure shared understanding and effective communication

These full-time positions are fixed term for up to 2 years and located onsite at Callaghan Campus. 

About you
You are a proactive and consultative Business Analyst who enjoys working across varied initiatives and stakeholder groups. You bring:
Proven experience in business analysis within digital, systems, or process improvement environments
Strong stakeholder engagement and facilitation skills, with the ability to translate complex needs into clear outcomes
Experience working within project or delivery frameworks, including agile, hybrid, or waterfall methodologies
A user-centred mindset with a focus on improving experience and service outcomes
Strong analytical, documentation, and communication skills
The ability to adapt quickly and work effectively across multiple projects and priorities
Experience in higher education, large complex organisations, or regulated environments will be highly regarded, but is not essential.

About our University

The University of Newcastle stands as a global leader distinguished by a commitment to equity and excellence. Our vision is to be a world-leading University for our regions and creating a better future for our regions and the globe. Underpinned by this vision and our values of excellence, equity, engagement and sustainability, the University of Newcastle’s Looking Ahead Strategic Plan 2020-2025 outlines the University’s commitment to delivering an exceptional student experience and serving our communities. 

For more information click here – Our Uni. 

What we offer

In addition to working for a university that is breaking boundaries, discovering new ways of thinking and cementing a place as a global leader, we offer a range of benefits to our employees to ensure you balance your commitments, stay healthy and work effectively. 

These include: 

Attractive remuneration package and excellent employment conditions in line with University of Newcastle professional staff conditions.
Flexible working arrangements (in line with the University’s Flexible Work Policy
17% super and salary packaging
Additional University Holiday days, generous personal leave and parental leave, annual leave loading and additional purchased leave scheme
Discounts in private health insurance, gym memberships, software, travel and more
Wellbeing programs

If you are a Business Analyst looking to broaden your experience, work on meaningful initiatives, and make a tangible difference, we encourage you to apply

Your next steps 

Please visit here for a guide on how to apply for a role. 

If viewing this on a job board other than the University's please click ‘Apply’ to reach the University's website, where a copy of the Position Description can be accessed. Please download a copy before commencing your application. 

Your application must include: 

Your resume
A cover letter outlining your motivation to apply for this opportunity
 A statement addressing the Essential Criteria listed in the job description demonstrating your qualifications and experience with examples.

To ensure that your application receives full consideration, it's important to structure and address the selection criteria outlined in the application process. This helps us better understand your experience and suitability for the role. We appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to reviewing your application.

Please upload your Cover Letter and response to the requested Criteria as one PDF document.

Your Cover Letter and Response to the Essential Criteria should not exceed 4 pages (approximately 2,000 words).

Applications for this position will only be accepted from those with Australian residency or a valid work permit. We are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this role. 

For specific position enquiries, please contact name Vinod Mudundi (02) 4921 6491or via email Vinod.Mudundi@newcastle.edu.au

 Having Difficulties? Please reach out to us: employment@newcastle.edu.au

Closing date: Tuesday 27th January 2026 11:59pm AEST

We are excited to be Looking Ahead with you!
